cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles (100 km) south of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest just south of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest into the central Gulf of Mexico and approach the Texas-Louisiana coastline mid-week, then curve inland toward the lower Mississippi Valley and the Mid-South.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas / southwest Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Much of Cuba, Little Cayman & Cayman Brac, and the Dry Tortugas (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Cuba today; Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward toward Mississippi/Alabama later this week
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring occasional gusts below gale force late week; damaging winds not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (port is far inland on the Illinois River).
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of remnant tropical rainfall possible late Friday into Saturday, enough for minor ponding but not river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief lightning and localized visibility reductions in heavy rain showers could disrupt barge and lock operations.
